question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Professor Denis is fantastic! Not only is he incredibly knowledgeable, but he also brings a wealth of experience and insight to the class. His ability to connect theoretical concepts with real-world applications makes the material engaging and relevant. He encourages thoughtful discussions and challenges students to think critically, creating a stimulating and supportive learning environment. You will get a thorough understanding of China's science and technology policies, focusing on real-world challenges and innovations. The multidisciplinary approach helps you connect political economy, technology, and global relations. With rich case studies, interactive discussions, and high-quality readings, it fosters critical thinking and practical knowledge. This course is perfect for students interested in global innovation dynamics, China's technological rise, or the intersection of policy and science. And, Professor Simon is definitely the one to guide you through this complex and fascinating subject. His passion for the topic and dedication to his students make the learning experience truly exceptional. If you want to gain a deep understanding of China's innovation strategies and their global impact, this course, led by Professor Denis Simon, is an opportunity you shouldn’t miss.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: The weekly reading is a lot, but prepares you for the midterms very well. Overall, the grading is not too harse.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: Un-learn what you think you know about China/US relations. It is difficult to step out of binaries of liberalism/socialism but to reduce topics such as China based on prior subjectivity may reduce what you can get out of this course.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: It is highly recommended for students who want to become experts on China, and it is also beneficial for students who want to interact with Chinese students.

response_text: Best course this semester

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: First of all, I developed critical understanding of the context and imperatives of East Asian Studies. The question of what it means to be an Asian Asianist allowed me to deeply engage with our reading materials and speakers from various academic and disciplinary backgrounds. Secondly, I developed writing skills on generalizing and discussing about the arguments made by our speakers. Thirdly, I was able to reflect on the possibilities and limitations of my own discipline and at the same time bridging conversation with other disciplines.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I've learned a great deal about the "secrets of academia." Professor Chow meticulously introduces disciplines and methodologies by inviting professors from different fields each week, a valuable experience not easily found elsewhere. Through interactions with these professors, I've grasped the subtle nuances between disciplines, topics, academic institutions, and departments. This understanding will be immensely helpful for my future doctoral applications.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: We get to know more about the concepts of Asia and academic disciplines through this course, and we meet and talk to so many outstanding professors of our discipline.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The guest speakers are all very inspiring.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The second half guest speaker section was definitely novel and inspiring to me, which I would strongly recommend to keep in the future.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The learning environment of this class is inclusive and supportive. Students were often give the chance to speak up and interact with each other. The speaker sessions are also very helpful to bridge conversation between various disciplines and research topics. Additionally, students were given the chance to introduce themselves succinctly to the speakers. This allowed us to practice and improve our elevator pitch.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The classroom atmosphere is incredibly dynamic and diverse. The academic materials introduced in this class are highly significant and core works within the field, which I intend to utilize in my following projects.

response_text: The course incorporates both methodology and real-life experiences. It indeed urges me to reflect my position as an Asianist.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: I recommend taking this course if you are interested in East Asian studies but also anything that's beyond this academic discipline. If you are interested in working with and knowing about other scholars, this course fits you very well.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: An essential course for beginners in East Asian Studies due to its diverse range of topics and the rare opportunity to engage with various professors. It's also recommended for senior students if the topics align with their research interests.

question_text: What would you like to say about this course to a student who is considering taking it in the future?
response_text: A great course for you to get started on Asian studies.

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text:
- Knowledge about East Asia as a discipline 
- Skills in moderating an academic discussion 
- Insights into the research of various scholars dealing with East Asia

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: The history of East Asian Studies; New theories and trends in Asian history;  New theories and trends in Asian literature

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: 1. Professor Ara Wilson's concept of queer regionalism is especially insightful, as it negotiates the dominant Western queer studies with cultural contexts in East Asian society. 2. Professor Qiao's illustrations on the Homeowner Associations in China shows how grassroots organizations not only function hand in hand with the state power but also grant a degree of agency for ordinary people. 3. I've been intrigued by the approach that views Asia as a method instead of the object of study, which stresses cross-regional culture flow and Asia's cultural specificity as a whole.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The first half of the course is based on some fundemantal knowledge about East Asian studies, and the second half of the course have invited scholars from discipline but work in east Asia to give guest lecture, I have learned a lot and have able to build a basic structure of how to do academic research from different perspective and also using different methodology.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: Having weekly guest speakers and QA; having assignment #1 and customized assignment #2 are helpful; the final short presentation and advice.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: This course is awesome! Everyone should take this course. Professor Chow and Professor Duara are well-respected, understanding, caring, and knowledgeable. They provide a productive and supportive class. It's my favorite!

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: The instructors invited a diverse group of guest speakers. They also reached a balance of introducing faculties and academic knowledge as well as caring for students. In this way, this course, as the core course for East Asian Studies students, helps form a closer and more caring community.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I think the form of this class, with professors from various disciplines invited to give lectures on their work, has broadened my view on East Asian studies and shown me lots of possibilities of this discipline.
